title: Do people seriously not know that Darius is immobile and wants long, stationary fights?
body: I keep playing games as {{champion:122}}  where someone like {{champion:36}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:102}}  will just stand still trading autos with me until my passive triggers and I dunk them, then bitch all game about how broken Darius is. Is he just so manly that people's brains shut down as soon as Darius comes onto their screen? Are they so terrified to give that 15% missing health heal that they'd rather die? I have no idea, but people weren't this stupid about him before the rework. People actually tried to kite and poke back then.

replies.body: No, it's just that escaping darius is impossible. He has crippling strike so you can never escape. If you do some how manage to escape he will just pull you back in. Then use crippling strike again. So instead of killing yourself trying to escape you might as well fight him.

After I get deadmans plate my lane is pretty much won, get speed boost from dead mans Q auto with a slow proc from deadmans, auto again, E wait for auto attack than W and finally hydra into ult.

T.Hydra and Deadmans plate are the biggest buffs to his kit.

When would you say is the best time to engage on Darius mid-late game? Keep in mind that there are other players on his team. You can't just watch out for him alone.

Mundo, Trundle, Olaf, and Udyr are both considered immobile as well, but for some reason they're not as much of a problem as Darius and Garen are right now. Now why could that be?
